Intel ® Integrated Performance Primitives
USC ALC filter

Overview
USC ALC description
 

Overview

The USC ALC (Audio Level Control) filer has been implemented using the Intel ® Integrated Performance Primitives (Intel ® IPP) Speech Coding functions.  The USC ALC filter supports 16bit narrowband 8000 Hz or wideband 16000 Hz PCM signal compression with 10ms frame length and produce output 8000 Hz or wideband 16000 Hz PCM signal with predefined level -6 dBm0.

Additional information on this software as well as other Intel ® Software Development Products is available at http://developer.intel.com/software/products/ .

USC ALC description

For USC Interface description refer to USC manual. 

 

USC ALC filter parameters:

  • Filter name: IPP_ALC

  • Algorithm: Intel proprietary 

  • Linkage: USC_ALC_Fxns

  • Sampling rate: 16bit linear 8000, 16000 Hz

  • Minimum frame: 10ms

  • Maximum frame: 10ms

  • Preferable frame: 10ms

  • Output frame types (value): ACTIVE

  • Predefined output signal level: -6 dBm0

  • Standards: ITU-T G.169
